jobDescription: Modern enterprise marketing is increasingly complex, fast-moving, and dynamic, and it is critical for any marketing organization to adapt and execute as one team. NVIDIA is seeking a driven self-starter to come be a part of our Enterprise Marketing team as a marketing analyst intern. In this role, you will drive and impact change on shared marketing standards, processes and tools; collaborate with key stakeholders across the marketing disciplines; produce key business insights from data analytics; and support the infrastructure of the Enterprise Marketing organization.  We are now looking for a Marketing Analyst Intern. What you’ll be doing:You will collect, organize, and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from multiple sources to generate business insights.Craft dashboards to summarize and track marketing campaign plans, progress, and results.Review and manage the organization and content of shared collaboration tools.What we need to see:You have strong organizational and analytical skillsYou are creative and have a problem-solving mentalityExcellent written and oral communication skillsAble to work with multiple teamsYou possess the desire to learn new concepts and toolsComfortable working with spreadsheets and large sets of dataYou are proficient with Microsoft Suite toolsYou are currently pursuing your Bachelor’s degreeWays to stand out from the crowd:You have previous internship experienceYou exhibit a can-do attitude and a growth-mindset With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be a highly desirable employer. We have some of the most brilliant and talented people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our elite teams are rapidly growing. If you're creative and independent with a real passion for your work, we want to hear from you.  NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
